content: Judah Threatened with Invasion
“If you will return to Me,
And if you will put away your detestable things  remove your man-made gods from My sight,
And not stray  waver,
And if you swear [your oaths], ‘As the  lives,’
In truth, in justice, and in righteousness,
Then the nations will bless themselves in Him,
And in Him they will glory.”
For this is what the LORD says to the men of Judah and to Jerusalem,

“It shall come about in that day,” says the LORD, “that the heart  courage of the king will fail (be paralyzed), and also the heart of the princes; the priests will be appalled and the prophets will be astounded  horrified.”

Then I said, “Alas, Lord GOD! Surely You have completely deceived  misled this people and Jerusalem, [for the prophets represented You as] saying [to Your people], ‘You will have peace,’ but [in fact] a sword reaches to their throat.”

In that time it will be said to this people and to Jerusalem, “A scorching wind from the barren heights in the wilderness [comes at My command] against the daughter of My people—not [a wind] to winnow and not to cleanse [from chaff, as when threshing, but]
a wind too strong  full for this comes at My word. Now I will also speak judgment against My people.”
Lament over Judah’s Devastation
My soul, my soul! I writhe in anguish  pain! Oh, the walls of my heart!
My heart is pounding  throbbing within me;
I cannot be silent,
For you have heard, O my soul,
The sound of the trumpet,
The alarm of war.
News of one [terrible] disaster comes close after another,
For the whole land is devastated;
Suddenly my tents are spoiled  destroyed,
My [tent] curtains [ruined] in a moment.
How long [O ] must I see the banner [marking the way for flight]
And hear the sound of the trumpet [urging the people to run for safety]?
“For My people are stupid  foolish,” [says the  to Jeremiah];
“They do not know Me;
They are foolish children
And have no understanding.
They are shrewd [enough] to do evil,
But they do not know [how] to do good.”
